text:
I have MyPrivatePackage that works with HTTP 0.9, and try to install JuliaWebAPI package that works with HTTP 0.8, and get errors with compatibility check:
```(@v1.5) pkg> add JuliaWebAPI
  Resolving package versions...
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package JuliaWebAPI [480116ec]:
 JuliaWebAPI [480116ec] log:
 ├─possible versions are: [0.4.0-0.4.1, 0.5.0-0.5.1, 0.6.0-0.6.2] or uninstalled
 ├─restricted to versions * by an explicit requirement, leaving only versions [0.4.0-0.4.1, 0.5.0-0.5.1, 0.6.0-0.6.2]
 └─restricted by compatibility requirements with HTTP [cd3eb016] to versions: uninstalled — no versions left
   └─HTTP [cd3eb016] log:
     ├─possible versions are: [0.6.10-0.6.14, 0.7.0-0.7.1, 0.8.0-0.8.19, 0.9.0-0.9.5] or uninstalled
     └─restricted to versions 0.9 by MyPrivatePackage [209e6102], leaving only versions 0.9.0-0.9.5
       └─MyPrivatePackage [209e6102] log:
         ├─possible versions are: 0.1.0 or uninstalled
         └─MyPrivatePackage [209e6102] is fixed to version 0.1.0```
I thought that if in a single environment I install two packages that have different versions of dependent package, it should install both versions of  dependent package? Or only a single dependent package version can exist in a single environment?

elements.text: I have MyPrivatePackage that works with HTTP 0.9, and try to install JuliaWebAPI package that works with HTTP 0.8, and get errors with compatibility check:

(@v1.5) pkg> add JuliaWebAPI
  Resolving package versions...
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package JuliaWebAPI [480116ec]:
 JuliaWebAPI [480116ec] log:
 ├─possible versions are: [0.4.0-0.4.1, 0.5.0-0.5.1, 0.6.0-0.6.2] or uninstalled
 ├─restricted to versions * by an explicit requirement, leaving only versions [0.4.0-0.4.1, 0.5.0-0.5.1, 0.6.0-0.6.2]

         └─MyPrivatePackage [209e6102] is fixed to version 0.1.0

I thought that if in a single environment I install two packages that have different versions of dependent package, it should install both versions of  dependent package? Or only a single dependent package version can exist in a single environment?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
There will only be one version of every package in the environment.

elements.text: There will only be one version of every package in the environment.

text: So, how should I get packages without adding them to my current environment?

elements.text: So, how should I get packages without adding them to my current environment?

text: You just have to find a compatible state.

elements.text: You just have to find a compatible state.

text: Should I create a separate environment only to load a package?

elements.text: Should I create a separate environment only to load a package?

text: This is strange, especially given that every package has its own environment, so I should be able to download it without adding in any current envs, right?

elements.text: This is strange, especially given that every package has its own environment, so I should be able to download it without adding in any current envs, right?

text: Every package does not have its own env.

elements.text: Every package does not have its own env.

text: Did I miss something? AFAIK environment is set with a `Project.toml` and `Manifest.toml` couple of files, and there are such files for every package. And also, when I `dev` a package, I can then switch to its own env by typing `]activate PackageName`
